result.execSummary:
The defendant David C Dessart was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay $100 fine plus costs. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Submit DNA sample. Write minimum 250 word apology letter within 30 days of sentencing.
Obtain AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Stayed, to be used at discretion of Court through petition by  Dept. of Corrections.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David C Dessart

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Impose 30 days of the stayed conditional jail time with Huber granted.

Defendant David C Dessart in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 1. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty of Count 1. Count 2 is dismissed but read in for sentencing. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.
Status conference on August 23, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant David C Dessart in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises of offer that requires payment in advance, requests status in about 45 days. Court questions payments. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty plea(s). Set for trial and pre-trial.

Defendant David C Dessart in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial. State does not have Information, will have it filed by end of day. Defense requests arraignment be set about 60 days out due to Defendant's need to pay significant amount. Bond continues as is.  Arraignment scheduled for June 23, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant David C Dessart in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises of offer that requires payment in advance, advises that Defendant is starting job on Monday, requests 60 to 90 days. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for April 26, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Additional Request for Electronic Discovery for Door County Cases
No contact direct or indirect with JJ or his property at 399 South Hall Road, Brussels.

Defendant David C Dessart in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions Defendant on non-appearance. Defense advises of mistake over date. Court quashes warrant. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Bond set. Defense advises that Defendant will waive time limits for prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver.  Status conference scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Defendant David C Dessart not in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews citation, orders bench warrant.
